intro: Quercus mongolica f. longifolia, commonly known as the Mongolian oak variant with long leaves, is a deciduous tree native to parts of East Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, serrated leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The tree produces small, acorn-like fruits that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in mixed forests. Its ecological role includes soil stabilization and providing habitat for numerous organisms.
